item.title: .NET backend providing REST

item.title: AngularJS and CORS
item.description: TL;DR While splitting my AngularJS demo app into independent back- and frontend projects (running two different servers) I stumbled across cross domain issues during development. This post describes how to implement CORS on the server and/or client side of an application.

item.title: link collection #1
item.description: When I try to learn new technologies I stumble across many sites. If a site is useful to the problem at hand, I normally add a comment in my source code referencing the URL.

item.title: RESTful CRUD with AngularJS
item.description: This post will show how to perform typical CRUD (create, read, update and delete) operations in AngularJS when consuming a RESTful web service. A prerequisite for this demo is a working RESTful web service.

item.title: AngularJS example using a Java RESTful web service
item.description: AngularJS is the current MVV-Whatever JavaScript framework by Google. Among other things, it provides bidirectional data binding. Although I’m neither a Java nor a JavaScript expert, I choose the following scenario for my ‘Hello-World’ example:
